required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prasugrel Versus Placebo in Adult Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Multicenter Study of Prasugrel Compared to Placebo in Adult Patients With Sickle Cell Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to assess the safety of Prasugrel in adult patients with sickle cell disease (SCD) by monitoring the rate and severity of hemorrhagic events requiring medical intervention compared to placebo for 30 days.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hemorrhagic Events Requiring Medical Intervention During the Treatment Duration
primary_outcome.description: A hemorrhagic event requiring medical intervention. Medical intervention was defined as any medical attention resulting in therapy or further investigation during the 30-day treatment duration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hemorrhagic Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) During the Treatment Duration
secondary_outcome.description: TEAEs were defined as AEs that occurred or worsened after receiving the study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Days With Pain Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) During the Treatment Duration
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the intensity of pain due to SCD each day in the daily pain diaries. A scale of 0 to 9 was used, with 0 indicating no pain, and 9 indicating unbearable pain. A response range of 1 to 9 indicated the participant experienced pain due to SCD, whereas a response of 0 indicated participant did not experience pain due to SCD. The percentage of days with pain (pain rate) was calculated as follows: Pain rate = 100*(Total number of days with pain/number of daily pain diaries completed). Number of daily pain diaries completed was number of nonmissing pain intensity responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pain Events Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) Requiring Medical Attention During the Treatment Duration
secondary_outcome.description: Pain requiring medical attention was defined 2 ways: (1) if the participant attended an unplanned doctor's appointment or clinic visit, visited the emergency room, or was admitted to hospital due to sickle cell pain, or (2) if the participant experienced a vaso-occlusive crisis (VOC), acute chest syndrome, or hepatic sequestration at least once during the treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelet Reactivity Index (PRI) Measured by Vasodilator-Associated Stimulated Phosphoprotein (VASP) at 30 Days
secondary_outcome.description: PRI was calculated by VASP phosphorylation assay using flow cytometry. The PRI indicates the level of P2Y12 inhibition. A low PRI reflects strong inhibition of P2Y12, whereas a high PRI reflects weak/absent inhibition of P2Y12. The Least Squares (LS) Mean values were calculated from a mixed-effects model repeated measures (MMRM) analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of Pain Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) During the Treatment Duration
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded intensity of pain due to SCD each day in daily pain diaries using a pain scale. A scale of 0 to 9 was used, with 0=no pain and 9=unbearable pain. A response range of 1 to 9 indicated participant experienced pain due to SCD, whereas a response of 0 indicated participant did not experience pain due to SCD. Pain intensity was the average of a participant's pain ratings. Average pain intensity=(Sum of all nonmissing pain intensity responses/number of daily pain diaries completed). Number of daily pain diaries completed is number of nonmissing pain intensity responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: P2Y12 Reaction Units (PRU) as Measured by Accumetrics VerifyNow® P2Y12 (VN P2Y12) at 30 Days
secondary_outcome.description: PRU represents the rate and extent of adenosine (ADP)-stimulated platelet aggregation. The VN P2Y12 assay is a point-of-care device that measures platelet aggregation with single-use, disposable cartridges. A low PRU reflects stronger inhibition of P2Y12, whereas a high PRU reflects weaker inhibition of P2Y12. The Least Squares Mean values were calculated from a mixed-effects model repeated measures analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.

arm_group.description: Participants were to receive 7.5 milligrams (mg) of prasugrel orally, once daily if they weighed ≥60 kilograms (kg) and if pharmacodynamic (PD) measures indicated that the 5-mg prasugrel dose did not produce a steady-state PD response equivalent to inhibition of platelet activation (IPA) ≥25%. Because these criteria were not met, no participants received 7.5 mg of prasugrel.

intervention.description: Administered orally, once daily for 30 days.
Administered orally, once daily for 30 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with Sickle Cell Disease (SCD).
- Are greater than or equal to 50 kilograms (kg) at time of screening.
- Are not currently being treated with an investigational drug (use of hydroxyurea, which is not an investigational drug, is permitted under this protocol if the patient has been on a stable dose for at least 30 days prior to randomization and has no signs of hematological toxicity at screening.
- Agree to use a reliable method of birth control during the study or are women not of child-bearing potential due to surgical sterilization (hysterectomy or bilateral oophorectomy or tubal ligation) or menopause.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute painful crisis (requiring medical attention) within 30 days prior to screening.
- Have a concomitant medical illness (for example, terminal malignancy) that, in the opinion of the investigator, is associated with reduced survival over the expected treatment period (approximately 30 days).
- Severe hepatic dysfunction (cirrhosis, portal hypertension, or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) greater than or equal to 3x upper limit of normal [ULN]).
- Renal dysfunction requiring chronic dialysis.
- Contraindication for antiplatelet therapy.
- History of intolerance or allergy to approved thienopyridines.
- Have signs or symptoms of an infection.
- Hypertension (systolic blood pressure >180 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) or diastolic blood pressure >110 mm Hg) at the time of screening or randomization.
- Hematocrit <18%.
- Any history of bleeding diathesis, bleeding requiring in-hospital treatment, or papillary necrosis.
- Active internal bleeding.
- History of spontaneous gastrointestinal (GI) bleeding requiring in-hospital treatment.
- Gross hematuria. Microhematuria, common in SCD patients, is not a contraindication.
- Platelet count <100,000 per cubic millimeter.
- Any history of intraocular hemorrhage.
- Prior history of transient ischemic attack (TIA), ischemic stroke, hemorrhagic stroke, or other intracranial hemorrhage.
- Known history of intracranial neoplasm, arteriovenous malformation, or aneurysm.
- Have clinical findings, in the judgment of the investigator, associated with an increased risk of bleeding.
- Have an international normalized ratio (INR) of greater than 1.5 at screening.
- Have had recent surgery (within 30 days prior to screening) or are scheduled to undergo surgery within the next 60 days.
- History of menorrhagia requiring medical intervention.

group.title: 7.5 mg Prasugrel
group.description: Participants were to receive 7.5 milligrams (mg) of prasugrel orally, once daily if they weighed ≥60 kilograms (kg) and if pharmacodynamic (PD) measures indicated that the 5-mg prasugrel dose did not produce a steady-state PD response equivalent to inhibition of platelet activation (IPA) ≥25%. Because these criteria were not met, no participants received 7.5 mg of prasugrel.

group.description: Participants received placebo orally, once daily for 30 days.

group.description: Participants received 5 mg of prasugrel orally, once daily for 30 days.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Sickle-Cell Genotype
measure.description: The number of participants for this baseline measure differs from the overall number of baseline participants because 1 participant from the 5-mg prasugrel arm did not have sickle cell disease (SCD), but possessed the thalassemia trait.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hemorrhagic Events Requiring Medical Intervention During the Treatment Duration
outcome.description: A hemorrhagic event requiring medical intervention. Medical intervention was defined as any medical attention resulting in therapy or further investigation during the 30-day treatment duration.
outcome.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they actually received.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Hemorrhagic Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) During the Treatment Duration
measure.description: TEAEs were defined as AEs that occurred or worsened after receiving the study drug.
measure.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they actually received.

outcome.title: Percentage of Days With Pain Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) During the Treatment Duration
outcome.description: Participants recorded the intensity of pain due to SCD each day in the daily pain diaries. A scale of 0 to 9 was used, with 0 indicating no pain, and 9 indicating unbearable pain. A response range of 1 to 9 indicated the participant experienced pain due to SCD, whereas a response of 0 indicated participant did not experience pain due to SCD. The percentage of days with pain (pain rate) was calculated as follows: Pain rate = 100*(Total number of days with pain/number of daily pain diaries completed). Number of daily pain diaries completed was number of nonmissing pain intensity responses.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they were randomized to. The analysis was performed in the ITT population who recorded pain intensity in at least 1 daily pain diary.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo orally, once daily for 30 days.

group.title: 5 mg Prasugrel
group.description: Participants received 5 mg of prasugrel orally, once daily for 30 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Days With Pain Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) During the Treatment Duration
measure.description: Participants recorded the intensity of pain due to SCD each day in the daily pain diaries. A scale of 0 to 9 was used, with 0 indicating no pain, and 9 indicating unbearable pain. A response range of 1 to 9 indicated the participant experienced pain due to SCD, whereas a response of 0 indicated participant did not experience pain due to SCD. The percentage of days with pain (pain rate) was calculated as follows: Pain rate = 100*(Total number of days with pain/number of daily pain diaries completed). Number of daily pain diaries completed was number of nonmissing pain intensity responses.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they were randomized to. The analysis was performed in the ITT population who recorded pain intensity in at least 1 daily pain diary.

analysis.p_value_desc: Pain rate was analyzed using an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model, with baseline pain intensity, treatment group, and stratification variable sickle-cell genotype as explanatory variables.
analysis.estimate_desc: Least Squares (LS) Mean Difference is for 5 mg prasugrel minus placebo.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pain Events Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) Requiring Medical Attention During the Treatment Duration
outcome.description: Pain requiring medical attention was defined 2 ways: (1) if the participant attended an unplanned doctor’s appointment or clinic visit, visited the emergency room, or was admitted to hospital due to sickle cell pain, or (2) if the participant experienced a vaso-occlusive crisis (VOC), acute chest syndrome, or hepatic sequestration at least once during the treatment period.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they were randomized to. The analysis was performed in the ITT population who completed at least 1 page of the daily pain diary or with pain endpoint case report form (CRF) data available.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo orally, once daily for 30 days.

group.title: 5 mg Prasugrel
group.description: Participants received 5 mg of prasugrel orally, once daily for 30 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pain Events Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) Requiring Medical Attention During the Treatment Duration
measure.description: Pain requiring medical attention was defined 2 ways: (1) if the participant attended an unplanned doctor’s appointment or clinic visit, visited the emergency room, or was admitted to hospital due to sickle cell pain, or (2) if the participant experienced a vaso-occlusive crisis (VOC), acute chest syndrome, or hepatic sequestration at least once during the treatment period.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they were randomized to. The analysis was performed in the ITT population who completed at least 1 page of the daily pain diary or with pain endpoint case report form (CRF) data available.

outcome.title: Platelet Reactivity Index (PRI) Measured by Vasodilator-Associated Stimulated Phosphoprotein (VASP) at 30 Days
outcome.description: PRI was calculated by VASP phosphorylation assay using flow cytometry. The PRI indicates the level of P2Y12 inhibition. A low PRI reflects strong inhibition of P2Y12, whereas a high PRI reflects weak/absent inhibition of P2Y12. The Least Squares (LS) Mean values were calculated from a mixed-effects model repeated measures (MMRM) analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they actually received. The analysis was performed in the safety population who had both baseline and 30-day PRI measurements and a non-missing genotype.

group.description: Participants received placebo orally, once daily for 30 days.

group.description: Participants received 5 mg of prasugrel orally, once daily for 30 days.

measure.title: Platelet Reactivity Index (PRI) Measured by Vasodilator-Associated Stimulated Phosphoprotein (VASP) at 30 Days
measure.description: PRI was calculated by VASP phosphorylation assay using flow cytometry. The PRI indicates the level of P2Y12 inhibition. A low PRI reflects strong inhibition of P2Y12, whereas a high PRI reflects weak/absent inhibition of P2Y12. The Least Squares (LS) Mean values were calculated from a mixed-effects model repeated measures (MMRM) analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.
measure.population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they actually received. The analysis was performed in the safety population who had both baseline and 30-day PRI measurements and a non-missing genotype.

analysis.p_value_desc: A mixed-effects model repeated measures analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model was used.
analysis.estimate_desc: Least Squares Mean Difference is for 5 mg prasugrel minus placebo.

outcome.title: Intensity of Pain Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) During the Treatment Duration
outcome.description: Participants recorded intensity of pain due to SCD each day in daily pain diaries using a pain scale. A scale of 0 to 9 was used, with 0=no pain and 9=unbearable pain. A response range of 1 to 9 indicated participant experienced pain due to SCD, whereas a response of 0 indicated participant did not experience pain due to SCD. Pain intensity was the average of a participant's pain ratings. Average pain intensity=(Sum of all nonmissing pain intensity responses/number of daily pain diaries completed). Number of daily pain diaries completed is number of nonmissing pain intensity responses.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they were randomized to. The analysis was performed in the ITT population who had recorded the pain intensity in at least 1 daily pain diary.

group.description: Participants received 5 mg of prasugrel orally, once daily for 30 days.

measure.title: Intensity of Pain Related to Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) During the Treatment Duration
measure.description: Participants recorded intensity of pain due to SCD each day in daily pain diaries using a pain scale. A scale of 0 to 9 was used, with 0=no pain and 9=unbearable pain. A response range of 1 to 9 indicated participant experienced pain due to SCD, whereas a response of 0 indicated participant did not experience pain due to SCD. Pain intensity was the average of a participant's pain ratings. Average pain intensity=(Sum of all nonmissing pain intensity responses/number of daily pain diaries completed). Number of daily pain diaries completed is number of nonmissing pain intensity responses.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population consisted of all randomized participants. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they were randomized to. The analysis was performed in the ITT population who had recorded the pain intensity in at least 1 daily pain diary.

analysis.p_value_desc: Average pain intensity was analyzed using an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model, with baseline intensity, treatment group and stratification variable sickle-cell genotype as explanatory variables.
analysis.estimate_desc: Least Squares (LS) Mean Difference is for 5 mg prasugrel minus placebo.

outcome.title: P2Y12 Reaction Units (PRU) as Measured by Accumetrics VerifyNow® P2Y12 (VN P2Y12) at 30 Days
outcome.description: PRU represents the rate and extent of adenosine (ADP)-stimulated platelet aggregation. The VN P2Y12 assay is a point-of-care device that measures platelet aggregation with single-use, disposable cartridges. A low PRU reflects stronger inhibition of P2Y12, whereas a high PRU reflects weaker inhibition of P2Y12. The Least Squares Mean values were calculated from a mixed-effects model repeated measures analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.
outcome.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they actually received. The analysis was performed in the safety population who had both baseline and 30-day PRU measurements and a non-missing genotype.

measure.description: PRU represents the rate and extent of adenosine (ADP)-stimulated platelet aggregation. The VN P2Y12 assay is a point-of-care device that measures platelet aggregation with single-use, disposable cartridges. A low PRU reflects stronger inhibition of P2Y12, whereas a high PRU reflects weaker inhibition of P2Y12. The Least Squares Mean values were calculated from a mixed-effects model repeated measures analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time, and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.
measure.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication. Participants were analyzed according to the treatment they actually received. The analysis was performed in the safety population who had both baseline and 30-day PRU measurements and a non-missing genotype.

analysis.p_value_desc: A mixed-effects model repeated measures analysis with baseline measurement, stratification variable sickle cell genotype, treatment, time and time*treatment interaction as fixed effects, and participant as a random effect in the model.
analysis.estimate_desc: Least Squares (LS) Mean Difference is for 5 mg prasugrel minus placebo.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
